page.title: 19STEEL MAKING
page.content: The Port Talbot Steelworks The steelworks covers 2700 acres of land.The works employs 4830 people 149 of these are female.The works produces 46000 tonnes of steel in one week and 2.2 million tonnes a year. Great improvements to the works have been carried out costing 650 million pounds so far.Raw materials are mostly imported from abroad some examples of this are iron ore from Australia & Canada also coal is needed,this to is imported .Limestone and Oxygen also needed are bought locally. The finished product is transported all over Britain but 40% goes to the tinplate works at Velindre(swansea) The steelworks told us that they are in profit at this time.The steelworks is located on the shore which is ideal for water and a deep water harbour.
